173
(1) An appeal shall be lodged at the court that issued the decree and which may, following an appeal, change the previous decree by means of a new decree or a revocation, provided this does not affect the rights of other persons, based on the decree in question.
(2) If the court of first instance does not change or revoke its decree, it shall send the appeal to the court of second instance, irrespective of whether the appeal has been lodged within the time specified by an Act.
(3) The court of second instance shall, as a rule, decide only on appeals that have been lodged within the time specified by law; it may, however, also consider an appeal that was not lodged within the specified time when this does not affect the rights of other persons, based on the decree in question.
